title: MainIbem
author: MainIbem
content: Overtime I hardly made use of twitter account and it calls to my noticed that twitter logo was replaced to X instead of the previous logo. Now I was curious to know why such thing happened and why change logo X, does it positively affect the users in any way?I don't know how many of you are regular user of twitter since I barely relates over there and I noticed is not cool for me to always use since the sold out to Elon Musk that was my ending love of using that social network.If topic already existed I don't mind locking this thread.

comments.body: Well I read he just really likes something to do with that letter X. But I do not know why he likes it that much. But he does have a child named Xavier so maybe that is a reason.  And he already has company with the similar name, SpaceX.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: This shouldn't be a surprise, one should have expected it, and two reasons could be linked to the development.1. Elon Musk who owns X (formerly Twitter) has been known to identify with "X" as a symbol. The two images of SpaceX and his X Holdings Corp should speak a volume on this.2. He and the new CEO have indicated that the former Twitter would revolutionise into delivering more than the microblogging service it's known for. Renaming it to X is another step in rebranding it since financial services and others are expected from it soon.

comments.author: Porfirii
comments.body: Yes, the X couldn't be a surprise for those who follow Musk. Even the model X is one of Tesla's flagships. But I personally don't like it too much, and maybe it was just a coincidence, because only the change in brand is not a problem (maybe because of the prior purchase of the whole platform was the problem) but I haven't used my twitter account since the change. BTW, how long remains it active if you don't log in in the meantime?

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: It's like it is on his mind at all times. Look at the branding of the companies that he's got like SpaceX. So, with the rebranding of Twitter to X, he has talked about the super app before. And this could have something to do with this rebranding and it is very timely when he's got to get the attention of the world by having a beef against Mark Zuckerberg. I think it's not just a beef but publicity that he needs for X.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: AFAIK, Elon Musk owns the domain X.com since the year 2000. Maybe he rebranded Twitter in order to finally use that domain name. Maybe he is a fan of "The X-files" TV series of the Triple X(I remember that there was a wrestler with that nickname). The new X social platform will become a major competitor of the social platforms owned by Meta(FB, Insta, Threads) and it will be more censorship free and maybe more oriented towards the right wing conservative people. This is means that it will gather users from the former right wing social media websites like Parler.

comments.author: purinZ14
comments.body: Simple: he likes X. For whatever reason, he’s probably the only one who knows. And to answer you question it does not affect users positively at all. If anything, it’s a huge downgrade. He’s taken the unique identity of twitter and made it into something so unfamiliar and unrecognizable. Comparing to facebook and instagram, twitter was the only one who had its own verb substituting for the word ‘post’. If you say ‘tweet’, everyone knows you’re talking about twitter. He even changed that and went for the generic term ‘post’. Hope he realizes how important these unique traits to the app.

I saw some topic related to the twitter change, but I most of them more focused on Elon Musk, but then again the X company is actually Elon's personal obsession. Elon has been wanted to make the X company since he was still in PayPal, he wanted to change PayPal to X company but the boards reject that. He finally made SpaceX, and now when he has twitter as his very own company no board nothing, he could do what he has been wanted to do. Finally established X Company. Some people really bothered by this, but for me I really don't care, the platform is still offering the very same service nothing is changed, just some renaming, Retweet >> Repost. What's bothering me is acually the blue check mark submission, I use to rely on twitter to contact a customer support, and there are a lot of scammers pretend as a customer support, I used to just check whether it has checkmark or not, now I need to double check it.

Elon has been the same person with the same dream from day 1 and the reason for choosing X will remain his trade mark, nobody can explain the reason why he chose that except him and the people around him, everything that surrounds Elon Musk has X and it has the relation with Space X. There could be more reason why chose that to replace Twitter platform to X but in my opinion, the name X has already a big brand that is globally known and its reputation, it will be easier to brand it for to that instead of using the parent name Twitter.I am not sure, but it could also be attributed to the similar app(Thread) Zuckerberg created some days ago that mimics Twitter, and to protect the code and copyright, they have to change it to X to keep it from other people from abusing the creation.
